lead_paragraph: Federal health officials issued a broad advisory after Florida identified five new infections from local transmissions and a second active Zika zone.

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami Beach, and Pam Belluck from New York. Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Atlanta, Shivani Vora from New York, and Sabrina Tavernise from Washington.
byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and PAM BELLUCK

headline.print_headline: Pregnant Women Told to Avoid Area in Miami as Zika Virus Spreads
headline.main: Pregnant Women Advised to Avoid Travel to Active Zika Zone in Miami Beach

snippet: Federal health officials issued a broad advisory after Florida identified five new infections from local transmissions and a second active Zika zone....
abstract: Federal health officials advise pregnant women to avoid traveling anywhere in Miami-Dade County, which includes tourist mecca South Beach, as Zika virus continues to spread; combating virus in Miami is not easy task because of its high-rises, high winds and large crowds of people.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
